story.title: Once upon a time in the distant 2019...
story.description: My journey into frontend development began in 2019. While studying at university, I became interested in web development. Initially I set a simple goal - to create a basic website about my favorite Lo-Fi music theme. But at some point I discovered React and wanted to build a full-fledged SPA, and that's when things really took off

Evraz.stack: TypeScript, React 17-18, Effector, GraphQL, Websocket, Vite, Webpack, Echarts, Apexcharts, Highcharts, Charts.js
Evraz.projects: Working in a team of 12 on production digitalization projects. Mostly MVP projects: functionality is implemented quickly, then refactored and maintained if economically viable.
Evraz.achievements:
Delivered 8 projects from idea to working product. One of them - an exhaust system monitoring system at a sintering plant - won 1st place for economic efficiency in 2024, reducing equipment downtime by 7.2%/year.

Migrated system from polling to WebSocket: RPS decreased from ≈2,400 to 5/sec, traffic from ≈4.8 Gbit/s to 0.2 Gbit/s, server response from ≈6.1 sec to <120 ms.

As Core team member, developed UI kit to replace Ant, created 27+ components (buttons, calendars, tables, forms).

Rewrote major project using FSD architecture to simplify adding new features.

In 7-person team worked on replacing Power BI and SAP, created charts and graphs, used GraphQL with caching for dashboards. Implemented WebWorker for bundling websocket messages, reducing browser load and improving responsiveness

OneTwoTrip.stack: TypeScript, React, Redux, Redux-Saga, TanStack Query, Webpack, React Virtualized, Styled Components
OneTwoTrip.projects:
Worked on "Voyager" project in 20+ person team.

Domain - developing and improving UI for online travel booking platform with 500,000+ monthly users.
OneTwoTrip.achievements:
Increased TypeScript adoption in codebase, simplifying feature development and preventing many errors.

Implemented CSS tokens concept with designers, making color palette updates and cross-team collaboration easier.

Worked with bank partner to implement 3DS 2.0 protocols for payment processing.

Ensured successful PCI DSS audit compliance using OWASP Top 10 knowledge. Developed Backend for Frontend in Node.js to aggregate data from multiple endpoints into single request.

TwoGis.stack: TypeScript, React, Redux, Redux-Saga, TanStack Query, Webpack, React Virtualized, Styled Components
TwoGis.projects: Worked in 5-person team on Otello project - hotel booking platform, developing frontend part of service.
TwoGis.achievements:
Created UI components using React with internal design system, improved shared UI-Kit for development convenience.

Integrated REST API with backend, connecting third-party services.

Collaborated with designers and analysts to add animations and interactive elements, improving platform usability.

skills.experienceDescription:
This describes my commercial experience, excluding pet projects and freelance work. Of course this isn't everything, just key highlights.

After graduating I started job hunting in my hometown, my first company was 2GIS where I mastered React and clean code principles while learning development processes.

After a year I moved to Saint Petersburg and opened my resume again, joining OneTwoTrip where I learned security fundamentals while working with sensitive user payment data.

arts.title: Creating 3D scenes in Blender - my hobby
arts.description: I started learning Blender and was fascinated by its intuitive interface and ease of use. So 3D modeling became my favorite hobby.
